channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump signals no shutdown compromise on the Affordable Care Act, calling it ‘the worst Healthcare anywhere in the world’
item.description: Trump suggested Congress send money directly to people to buy health insurance.

item.title: Supplement your Spotify stream with these classic radio treasures
item.description: I love FM radio. It’s okay: You can call me a Luddite. My alarm clock is the local public radio station. I love toggling between a few music stations ...

item.title: Billionaire Peter Thiel warns if you ‘proletarianize the young people,’ don’t be surprised they end up communist
item.description: "Capitalism is not working for a lot of people in New York City. It’s not working for young people."

item.title: Trump wants his name on the Washington Commanders’ planned $3.7 billion stadium, and he has ‘plenty of cards to play,’ report says
item.description: "He can make it very difficult, through government environmental approvals and other things, to make sure everyone who wants this stadium to be built ...

item.title: How to Turn AI Competitiveness Into a Human Advantage
It’s not about inflation or the economy — the election instead delivered a ‘wake-up call’ on affordability politics, top pollster says
item.description: "But make no mistake, how much you pay at the cash register is going to determine who you vote for in these elections."

item.title: Toxicity in the Workplace Doesn’t Need to Be Managed, but Replaced With Engagement
item.description: Toxicity doesn’t just hurt companies—it hemorrhages them.

item.title: AI Isn’t Inherently Good or Bad. Leaders Must Decide to Use It Responsibly
item.description: Is genAI making us better or just faster? We get to decide how we will use it.

item.title: 9 Ways to Ensure People Remember What You Say
item.description: About half of what you’ve communicated to someone will be forgotten in just an hour.

item.title: Trump keeps touting a Thanksgiving meal basket from Walmart that’s 25% cheaper. But it has half as many items as last year
item.description: This year's basket includes just 15 items compared to last year's 29. It is missing many dessert items, including a pecan pie, mini marshmallows and m...

item.title: Apple Liquid Glass: You can’t turn it off in iOS26, but now you can tone it down
item.description: Two months ago, Apple released iOS 26 for the iPhone. The new operating system includes several productivity and other enhancements , but the main fea...

item.title: Box CEO: AI-First Is a Nonnegotiable, Here Are the 2 Steps to Integrate It Effectively
item.description: Aaron Levie spoke with Inc. about how to most effectively implement AI agents.

item.title: How failure taught me to succeed as an entrepreneur
item.description: Over the past 50 years in the shoe trade, I have had my fair share of failure. The biggest lesson I learned, at the start of my career, is not to devo...

item.title: This week in business: from AI turbulence to airline refunds
item.description: If you glanced at the headlines this week, you might think everything is fine. Markets are not in full panic mode, unemployment is not spiking, and ea...

item.title: OpenAI wants your brand mascot on Sora. What could possibly go wrong?
item.description: When OpenAI launched its text-to-video app Sora in September, there was immediate blowback. To absolutely no one’s surprise, users on the platform had...
